entities.name: CLIMATE CHANGE
entities.description: A global phenomenon characterized by significant changes in temperature, precipitation, and weather patterns, impacting various sectors including agriculture

entities.name: GLOBAL AGRICULTURE
entities.description: The worldwide system of farming and food production, which is highly sensitive to climate conditions and changes

entities.name: CALIFORNIA
entities.description: A state in the United States that has experienced prolonged droughts affecting its agricultural sector

entities.name: AUSTRALIA
entities.description: A country that has faced significant droughts impacting its agricultural output and food prices

entities.name: PESTS AND DISEASES
entities.description: Biological organisms that can spread more widely due to warmer temperatures, affecting crop health and yields

entities.name: WATER AVAILABILITY
entities.description: The availability of water for agricultural use, which is affected by changes in precipitation and increased evaporation rates

entities.name: SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE
entities.description: Farming practices that aim to be environmentally friendly, economically viable, and socially responsible, helping to mitigate and adapt to climate change

entities.name: DROUGHT-RESISTANT CROP VARIETIES
entities.description: Crops developed to withstand periods of low water availability, helping farmers adapt to changing climate conditions

entities.name: PRECISION AGRICULTURE
entities.description: Techniques that use technology to optimize crop production and resource use, reducing the impact of climate change on agriculture

entities.name: AGROFORESTRY
entities.description: A land use management system in which trees or shrubs are grown around or among crops or pastureland, enhancing biodiversity and soil health

entities.name: CROP ROTATION
entities.description: A practice of growing different types of crops in the same area in sequential seasons to improve soil health and reduce pest and disease pressure

entities.name: ORGANIC FARMING
entities.description: A method of crop and livestock production that avoids the use of synthetic chemicals and focuses on ecological processes

entities.name: AGROECOLOGY
entities.description: A scientific discipline and a set of practices that apply ecological concepts and principles to the design and management of sustainable agricultural systems

entities.name: FOOD SECURITY
entities.description: The state of having reliable access to a sufficient quantity of affordable, nutritious food, which is threatened by climate change impacts on agriculture

entities.name: FOOD PRICES
entities.description: The cost of food, which can be affected by climate change through impacts on crop production and supply chains

entities.name: SUPPLY CHAINS
entities.description: The network of processes involved in the production, distribution, and sale of agricultural products, which can be disrupted by extreme weather events

entities.name: IRRIGATION SYSTEMS
entities.description: Methods and technologies used to provide water to crops, which are crucial for adapting to water scarcity caused by climate change

entities.name: RAINWATER HARVESTING
entities.description: A technique for collecting and storing rainwater for use in agriculture, helping to manage water scarcity

entities.name: GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS
entities.description: Gases that trap heat in the atmosphere, contributing to global warming and climate change, which can be reduced through sustainable agricultural practices

entities.name: BIODIVERSITY
entities.description: The variety and variability of life forms within a given species, ecosystem, or planet, which can be protected through sustainable agricultural practices

relations: Climate change impacts global agriculture through altered weather patterns, shifts in growing seasons, and changes in water availability
Climate change has led to prolonged droughts in California, affecting its agricultural sector
Climate change has caused significant droughts in Australia, impacting its agricultural output and food prices
Warmer temperatures due to climate change can lead to the spread of pests and diseases, affecting crop yields
Climate change affects water availability for agriculture through changes in precipitation and increased evaporation rates
Sustainable agriculture practices can help mitigate and adapt to the impacts of climate change
Drought-resistant crop varieties help farmers adapt to the water scarcity caused by climate change
Precision agriculture techniques can optimize resource use and reduce the impact of climate change on crop production
Agroforestry practices can enhance biodiversity and soil health, building resilience to climate change
Crop rotation can improve soil health and reduce pest and disease pressure, helping to adapt to climate change
Organic farming practices can reduce greenhouse gas emissions and improve soil health, contributing to climate change mitigation
Agroecology applies ecological principles to design sustainable agricultural systems, enhancing resilience to climate change
Extreme weather events, such as droughts and floods, are becoming more frequent and severe due to climate change
Climate change impacts on agriculture can threaten food security by reducing crop production and increasing food prices
Climate change can lead to increased food prices through its impact on crop production and supply chains
Climate change can disrupt agricultural supply chains through extreme weather events and changes in water availability
Irrigation systems are essential for adapting to the water scarcity caused by climate change
Rainwater harvesting is a sustainable practice that can help farmers adapt to the water scarcity caused by climate change
Reducing greenhouse gas emissions is crucial for mitigating the effects of climate change
Protecting biodiversity is important for building resilience to climate change and maintaining ecosystem health
Extreme weather events can devastate crops, disrupt supply chains, and lead to food shortages and price spikes
Global agriculture plays a critical role in ensuring food security, which is at risk due to climate change impacts
Efficient irrigation systems are crucial for managing water scarcity and ensuring crop production in the face of climate change
Rainwater harvesting helps manage water scarcity by collecting and storing rainwater for agricultural use
Sustainable agricultural practices can help reduce greenhouse gas emissions, contributing to climate change mitigation
Sustainable agricultural practices can help protect biodiversity by promoting ecological balance and reducing the use of harmful chemicals

Extreme weather events can lead to food price spikes due to reduced crop yields and supply chain disruptions
Extreme weather events can cause food price spikes by reducing crop yields and disrupting supply chains
Extreme weather events can disrupt agricultural supply chains, affecting the distribution and availability of food
